intro: Licaria amara, commonly known as bitter licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a serrated edge, while the fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds. Due to its bitter taste, it is not widely cultivated but is of interest in botanical studies.
